channel.title: CVE Feed for Canonical -- apport
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Canonical -- apport

item.title: CVE-2021-3710|2024-09-17T01:41:25.529Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: An information disclosure via path traversal was discovered in apport/hookutils.py function read_file(). This issue affects: apport 2.14.1 versions prior to 2.14.1-0ubuntu3.29+esm8; 2.20.1 versions prior to 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm2; 2.20.9 versions prior to 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.26; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu27.20; 2.20.11 versions prior to 2.20.11-0ubuntu65.3;

item.title: CVE-2021-32552|2024-09-17T02:37:33.692Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-16 package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

item.title: CVE-2021-32547|2024-09-17T03:18:22.707Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the openjdk-lts package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

item.title: CVE-2021-25682|2024-09-17T00:46:19.717Z -- canonical -- apport
item.description: It was discovered that the get_pid_info() function in data/apport did not properly parse the /proc/pid/status file from the kernel.
